alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin; Madison; Sebastian; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 8:20PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN MADISON... NORTHWESTERN FRANKLIN...CRAWFORD...SEBASTIAN...SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHEASTERN SEQUOYAH AND NORTHEASTERN LE FLORE COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM CST... At 820 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles east of Lee Creek to 2 miles northeast of Poteau. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Poteau... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Greenwood... Alma... Barling... Pocola... Lavaca... Arkoma... Mulberry... Dyer... Hackett... Bonanza... Winslow... Midland... Cameron... Chester... Moffett... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 24. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma near mile marker 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
